ABSOLVED.Definition: (especially in religion or law) to free someone from guilt, blame, or responsibility for something

ALLIED.Definition: relating to the Allies (= the countries that fought against Germany and the other Axis countries in the Second World War)

ALLIES.Definition: a country that has agreed officially to give help and support to another one, especially during a war

ANTICIPATE.Definition: to imagine or expect that something will happen

ASSEMBLED.Definition: to come together in a single place or bring parts together in a single group

BREAK OUT.Definition: If something dangerous or unpleasant breaks out, it suddenly starts

BUZZWORD.Definition: a word or expression from a particular subject area that has become fashionable by being used a lot, especially on television and in the newspapers

CASTRATION.Definition: the process of removing the testicles of a male animal or human

CHAIN.Definition: (a length of) rings usually made of metal that are connected together and used for fastening, pulling, supporting, or limiting freedom, or as jewellery

CONTAINED.Definition: didn't go over a large distance, kept within a small area

CONVICTED.Definition: having officially been found guilty of a crime in a law court

CORRESPOND.Definition: to match or be similar or equal

CRYPTOGRAPHY.Definition: the practice of creating and understanding codes that keep information secret

CYANIDE.Definition: an extremely powerful poison that can kill people

DECIPHER.Definition: to discover the meaning of something written badly or in a difficult or hidden way

DECIPHERING.Definition: to discover the meaning of something written badly or in a difficult or hidden way

DEEMED.Definition: to consider or judge something in a particular way

ECCENTRIC.Definition: strange or unusual, sometimes in a humorous way

EMERGE.Definition: to appear by coming out of something or out from behind something

ENCRYPTED.Definition: to change electronic information or signals into a secret code (= system of letters, numbers, or symbols) that people cannot understand or use on normal equipment

ENCRYPTING.Definition: to change electronic information or signals into a secret code (= system of letters, numbers, or symbols) that people cannot understand or use on normal equipment

ENSURING.Definition: to make something certain to happen

ERA.Definition: a period of time of which particular events or stages of development are typical

ESPIONAGE.Definition: the discovering of secrets, especially political or military information of another country or the industrial information of a business

EVENTUAL.Definition: happening or existing at a later time or at the end, especially after a lot of effort, problems, etc.

FOR THAT MATTER.Definition: used to show that a statement is true in another situation

IMPENDING.Definition: used to refer to an event, usually something unpleasant or unwanted, that is going to happen soon

IMPOTENT.Definition: If a man is impotent, he cannot have sex because his penis cannot become hard or stay hard

IN INVERTED COMMAS.Definition: used in spoken English after a word or phrase to show that it has not been used accurately or that the opposite meaning is intended

LISTENING IN.Definition: If you listen in on a conversation or on someone talking, you listen, especially secretly, without saying anything

MAKE UP.Definition: to take the place of something lost or damaged or to compensate for something bad with something good

MORSE CODE.Definition: a system used for sending messages, in which letters and numbers are represented by short and long marks, sounds, or flashes of light

NONE OTHER.Definition: said when you want to show that someone or something is a surprising or exciting choice or example

NOT SO FAST.Definition: used in speech to say that one disagrees with what someone has said or to tell someone to stop or slow down

OESTROGEN.Definition: a female hormone that causes development and change in the reproductive organs (= organs involved in producing babies)

OUTBREAK.Definition: a time when something suddenly begins, especially a disease or something else dangerous or unpleasant

OVERHEARD.Definition: to hear what other people are saying without intending to and without their knowledge

PARDONED.Definition: If someone who has committed a crime is pardoned, that person is officially forgiven and their punishment is stopped

PARTIES.Definition: one of the people or groups of people involved in an official argument, arrangement, or similar situation

PATTERN.Definition: a particular way in which something is done, is organised, or happens

PRINCIPLES.Definition: a basic idea or rule that explains or controls how something happens or works

RADIATOR.Definition: a device, usually a container filled with water, that sends out heat, often as part of a heating or cooling system

SERIES.Definition: a number of similar or related events or things, one following another

SINKING.Definition: causing a ship to sink (to go below the surface of the water)

STRETCH OUT.Definition: to cause something to reach, often as far as possible, in a particular direction

TANKS.Definition: a large military fighting vehicle designed to protect those inside it from attack, driven by wheels that turn inside moving metal belts

TELL A MACHINE APART.Definition: tell the difference between a machine and something else

TISSUE.Definition: a group of connected cells in an animal or plant that are similar to each other, have the same purpose, and form the stated part of the animal or plant

TRAGIC.Definition: very sad, often involving death and suffering

YOU CAN BET.Definition: used to say that you are completely certain that something is true or will happen
